page.title: 02Surrey Sussex Border
page.content: Predominantly a wooded area mostly of oak and some coniferous plantations. A source of tributaries of the river Arun with adjacent water meadows. It is crossed by the B2133 with its ribbon development through the north of Loxwood and the older parts of Alfold village including the 13th century church, Loxwood Hall in the SE of the area has developed into a smart residential area with some substantial housing. In Alfold village the adjacent land is mostly mixed farming in the control of a charity. The Merchant Seamans re-habilitation centre with its own convalescent home and retirement houses. Some training is given in agriculture and horticulture. The remainder of the area is sparsely occupied with most houses residential and substantial.
